item.title: Using Emacs to port my blog from Octopress to Hugo
item.description: In my previous post I explained my motivations to move this blog to hugo. This post focuses on how I did this in Emacs. As a matter of fact, this post is actually on how I do any such task from within the comforts of Emacs. The post is therefore task agnostic and should be a basic demonstration of the capabilities of Emacs that I use. The purpose of this post is also to list down my workflow in detail for me to see any gaps in it.

item.title: Editing remote code with Emacs
item.description: Lately, I’ve been working on a code-base situated remotely on a server accessible over ssh. The network latency and size of the code repository prompted me to reconsider the method to edit such files. I discovered a few options I could use and finally settled with one of them.

item.title: Customizing Emacs
item.description: I believe the environment in which one works is directly responsible for one’s productivity. It’s the reason I think, it’s important to choose the right editor, font, etc.
